info.title: ZBOS MQTT API
info.description: API for communication with ZBOS by Zora Robotics.

local.description: This is the local robot broker.

language.description:
Optional. Set the language to have all translations filled in.
The language format is ISO 639-1 language code, Eg: 'en' or 'en-US'

name.description: Use name for a static name, or name_key for a translatable name

name_key.description: Use name for a static name, or name_key for a translatable name

key.description: Request key to create a unique subscription topic

publish.description: Get all applications with optional filters.

field.description: Field to check on. Note that the field should be camelCase, not snake_case

value.description: Value to check on. For numbers you should use 'min' and 'max'.

min.description: Minimum value, only usable for number fields

max.description: Maximum value, only usable for number fields

direction.description:
Direction to sort on.
Can be 'asc' or 'desc'.
The default direction is 'asc'

operator.description:
Operator for either the child filters, or this filter object itself.
Can be 'and', 'or' or 'not'.
Default is 'and'.
The root operator is always 'and'

match_type.description:
Match type for string values.
Can be 'exact', 'contains', 'starts_with', 'ends_with'.
The default match_type is 'contains'

filters.description:
Filters on which the operator will be applied.
If there are no child filters, the operator will be applied to the filter object itself.

field_filters.description:
Filters to apply on the child fields of the field.
Will only work if the field is an object, array/list or map.

language.description:
Optional. Set the language to have all translations filled in.
The language format is ISO 639-1 language code, Eg: 'en' or 'en-US'

id.description: This could be a package name, or some other defined unique ID

name.description: Use name for a static name, or name_key for a translatable name

name_key.description: Use name for a static name, or name_key for a translatable name

name.description: Use name for a static name, or name_key for a translatable name

name_key.description: Use name for a static name, or name_key for a translatable name

type.description:
List of available actions:
open: Opens an application handled by the RAILopen_control: Opens an application handled by the control
settings: Opens the settings, handled by the control
datasource: Edit the datasource, handled by the control
other: Should be handled by the app itself

data.description: Optional data that an action might need.

optional.description: Adds this application to the list of optional apps, which determines if the app is shown to the user

icon_uri.description: The path to an image on the robot or the url to an image

max_height.description: Optional, can be used to decrease payload size

publish.summary: Get the content of a specific application datasource file
publish.description:
Publish on this topic to get the content of a datasource
Payload is json with a key for the response topic {"key":aKey}

subscribe.description: Will return a JSON string with the content of the datasource data file

subscribe.description: A message object (with key 'success') is publish on this topic when the datasource has been saved

subscribe.description: Notify subscribers of a volume change.

Request the microphone to be released from use by third-party apps.

publish.summary: Start the camera stream of the selected camera.

publish.description: Send by the robot to start the webrtc handshake

id.description: sdpMid
sdpMid

publish.description: Start a QR code scan using the camera.

scan_id.description: Unique ID that will be used in related topics.

scan_timeout.description:
Timeout in seconds after which the scan should automatically be stopped.
Pass 0 to not have a timeout. 0 is also the default when no value was passed.

publish.description: Stop a QR code scan using the camera.

scan_id.description: Unique ID that should be the same as the one used in the start request.

subscribe.description: This event is published when a QR scan has stopped, either manually or due to a timeout.

scan_id.description: Unique ID that will be the same as the one used in the start request.

subscribe.description: This event is published every time a QR code is decoded while a scan is active.
Response indicating if login to the cloud was successful or not

subscribe.description:
List of possible error reasons:
'INVALID_ID': The block id is malformed/broken.
'INVALID_TYPE': The block type is malformed/broken.
'INVALID_BLOCK': One of the properties aside from id and type is malformed/broken.

type.description: Block type that caused the error, 'UNKNOWN' if not known

id.description: Block ID that caused the error, 'UNKNOWN' if not known

Payload "key" is optional

publish.summary: Get all string operation typessee <<zbos/composition/block/stringoperation/types/response/{key}>> for response

key.description: Required random key

language.description:
Optional. Set the language for all labels. Otherwise it will be the default language.
The language format is ISO 639-1 language code, Eg: 'en' or 'en-US'

arguments.description: Map of arguments for this string operation

key.description: Request key to create a unique subscription topic

Optional. Set the language for all labels. Otherwise it will be the default language.

has_second_argument.description: Determines whether a second argument is used for this operation

subscribe.description: Response with the status information for the WiFi, access point and cable

subscribe.description: Periodic status information for the WiFi, access point and cable
A list of all the scanned WiFi networks the robot can connect to

publish.description: Connect to a specific WiFi network

subscribe.description: A (json) message is published when the connection request was successful or not

publish.description: Forget a network. If the robot is connected to the given network, it will disconnect

subscribe.description: A (json) message is published when the forget request was successful or not

publish.description: Get an overview of all the networks that are saved on the robotsee <<zbos/connection/wifi/list/saved/response/{key}>> for response

subscribe.description: A list of all the saved networks that are stored on the robot

key.description: Request key to create a unique subscription topic

publish.description: Set specific WiFi network configuration (DHCP, IPv4, IPv6, subnetmask, default gateway).see <<zbos/connection/wifi/network/configure/response/{key}>> for response

subscribe.description: A (json) message is published when saving the configuration was successful or not

key.description: Request key to create a unique subscription topic

publish.description: Get the DNS configuration of the network the robot is connected tosee <<zbos/connection/wifi/dns/get/response/{key}>> for response

subscribe.description: Response with the DNS configuration of the connected network

key.description: Request key to create a unique subscription topic

publish.description: Set the DNS configuration of the network the robot is connected to.see <<zbos/connection/wifi/dns/set/response/{key}>> for response

subscribe.description: A (json) message is published when saving the DNS configuration was successful or not

key.description: Request key to create a unique subscription topic

subscribe.description: Response about the access point that the robot is broadcasting

publish.description: Set the access point configuration of the network that the robot is broadcasting.see <<zbos/connection/ap/config/set/response/{key}>> for response

Triggered when the access point/hotspot is turned off

subscribe.description: An event will be published when there is a problem detected with a motor or motor controller.

key.description: Request key to create a unique subscription topic

subscribe.description: An event will be published when there is a problem detected with a servo.

key.description: Request key to create a unique subscription topic

subscribe.description: All domotics systems that are configured

id.description: unique id of the domotics system

brand.description: brand of the domotics system, eg: homeassistant, creadomotics, ...

name.description: human-readable name of the domotics system

key.description: Request key to create a unique subscription topic

subscribe.description: Fires all systems when the configuration of any of the domotics systems changes

id.description: unique id of the domotics system

brand.description: brand of the domotics system, eg: homeassistant, creadomotics, ...

name.description: human-readable name of the domotics system

key.description: Required random key

ids.description: Optional, device ids to filter on

rooms.description: Optional, room ids to filter on

type.description: Optional, device type to filter on

system_ids.description: Optional, system ids to filter on

with_actions_only.description: Optional, if set to true, only devices with actions will be returned

language.description:
Optional. Set the language for all labels. Otherwise it will be the default language.
The language format is ISO 639-1 language code, Eg: 'en' or 'en-US'

subscribe.description: All domotics devices that are configured

id.description: Unique id

type.description: Device type. Different brands have different types

type_translation.description: Human-readable representation of the generic type

room.description: Optional, id of the room the device is in

tags.description: Optional, list of tags the device has

system_id.description: System ID this device belongs to

brand.description: Brand of the system this device belongs to

actions.description: Definitions of all actions you can perform with the device

attributes.description: Definitions of all attributes of the device

key.description: Request key to create a unique subscription topic

publish.description:
Updates all devices that match the "ids", "rooms", "tags", and "system_ids" filter
                |Leave any of the filters empty to ignore them.

key.description: Required random key

attributes.description: Map of attributes for the action

key.description: Required random key

rooms.description: Optional, room ids to filter on

system_ids.description: Optional, system ids to filter on

subscribe.description: All the domotics states with their full data

id.description: Unique id

room.description: Optional, id of the room the device is in

tags.description: Optional, list of tags the device has

system_id.description: System ID this device belongs to

brand.description: Brand of the system this device belongs to

data.description: The entire JSON as returned by the domotics system

key.description: Request key to create a unique subscription topic

subscribe.description: Fired when a state changed

id.description: Unique id

room.description: Optional, id of the room the device is in

tags.description: Optional, list of tags the device has

system_id.description: System ID this device belongs to

brand.description: Brand of the system this device belongs to

data.description: The entire JSON as returned by the domotics system

key.description: Required random key

system_ids.description: Optional, system ids to filter on

subscribe.description: All the possible event types that can occur

type.description: Type key of the event type

system_ids.description: System ids that have this event type

key.description: Request key to create a unique subscription topic

subscribe.description: Fired when a domotics event is fired

system_id.description: System ID this event originates from

data.description: The entire JSON of the event data, as returned by the domotics system

key.description: Required random key

id.description: Required ID of the camera device

system_id.description: Optional, system id to filter on

subscribe.description: Image of the camera

key.description: Request key to create a unique subscription topic

publish.description: Call a Home Assistant service, see https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/scripts/service-calls[^] for more information.

domain.description: The domain of the service, eg: 'light'

data.description: The data that should be passed to the service

system_ids.description: Optional, system ids of Home Assistant instances this call should execute on

publish.summary: Start continuous facetracking, see <<zbos/facetracking/detected/faces>> for events

subscribe.description: This topic will be published when faces are detected in a picture.

role.description: Optional, a descriptor for this person

ImageString.description: Optional, if this has a value (in base64) the given image will be used. Otherwise, a stream will be started to find a new person

options.description: Optional, the global options will be used if no value is given

mode.description: How closely the person must match

tries.description: How many times to check for a person before giving up

timeout.description: How long to look for a person before giving up

publish.summary: Add a new face to an existing person
publish.description:
[DEPRECATED]
Adding multiple faces is no longer necessary or supported

see <<zbos/facetracking/update_response>> for response

subscribe.summary: response: Add a new face to an existing person
subscribe.description:
[DEPRECATED]
Adding multiple faces is no longer necessary or supported

publish.summary: Request the list of registered persons

subscribe.summary: response: Request the list of registered persons

publish.summary: Request all data of a person

subscribe.summary: response: Request all data of a person

image.description: A base64 image of this person

subscribe.description: Fired when kiosk is active after being moved to the background

see <<zbos/kiosk/ready/get/response/{key}>> for response

subscribe.summary: response: Get installed applications on Kiosk

key.description: Request key to create a unique subscription topic
Request key to create a unique subscription topic

file_path.description: Required. The path to a PDF file to print.

media_size.description: Optional. The format of the paper to be printed, defaults to 'Letter'

printer_name.description: Optional, only used when auto print is enabled. The name of or part of the name of a printer, defaults to first available printer

auto_print.description: Optional. Whether to use the accessibility service to automatically print to the desired printer without user input

publish.summary: Get a list of media items

field.description: Field to check on. Note that the field should be camelCase, not snake_case

value.description: Value to check on. For numbers you should use 'min' and 'max'.

min.description: Minimum value, only usable for number fields

max.description: Maximum value, only usable for number fields

direction.description:
Direction to sort on.
Can be 'asc' or 'desc'.
The default direction is 'asc'

operator.description:
Operator for either the child filters, or this filter object itself.
Can be 'and', 'or' or 'not'.
Default is 'and'.
The root operator is always 'and'

match_type.description:
Match type for string values.
Can be 'exact', 'contains', 'starts_with', 'ends_with'.
The default match_type is 'contains'

filters.description:
Filters on which the operator will be applied.
If there are no child filters, the operator will be applied to the filter object itself.

field_filters.description:
Filters to apply on the child fields of the field.
Will only work if the field is an object, array/list or map.

key.description: Request key to create a unique subscription topic

subscribe.description: This event is published when an item in the media library list changes

id.description: Mandatory. A unique ID for the event

timestamp.description: Mandatory. The time at which the event occurred

type.description: Mandatory. The type of event this is, no dots allowed

source.description: Mandatory. What device produced this event, no dots allowed

value.description: Optional. A value relating to the event such as a temperature

data.description: Optional. Extra data related to the event

unit.description: Optional. The type of unit the value is expressed in such as C

alarms.description: Optional. Alarms attached to this event

severity.description: Mandatory. How critical the alarm is

persist.description: Mandatory. If this is an ongoing alarm

timestamp.description: Mandatory. When the alarm initially started

field.description: Field to check on. Note that the field should be camelCase, not snake_case

value.description: Value to check on. For numbers you should use 'min' and 'max'.

max.description: Maximum value, only usable for number fields

Direction to sort on.
Can be 'asc' or 'desc'.
The default direction is 'asc'

operator.description:
Operator for either the child filters, or this filter object itself.
Can be 'and', 'or' or 'not'.
Default is 'and'.
The root operator is always 'and'

match_type.description:
Match type for string values.
Can be 'exact', 'contains', 'starts_with', 'ends_with'.
The default match_type is 'contains'

If there are no child filters, the operator will be applied to the filter object itself.

field_filters.description:
Filters to apply on the child fields of the field.
Will only work if the field is an object, array/list or map.

subscribe.description: Request all monitoring services to register themselves using the topics below.

publish.description:
Add monitoring service with their default values and extra settings.
Settings can be retrieved using the settings API, see <<zbos/settings/get>>

source.description: Mandatory. The source of this monitoring service

type.description: Mandatory. The type of this monitoring service

default_settings.description: Optional. Any default settings to be overridden

hidden_default_settings.description: Optional. Hide certain default settings so the user can't change it

extraSettings.description: Optional. Any extra settings to be registered

key.description: Request key to create a unique subscription topic

subscribe.description: A message (Boolean) is publish on this topic when an animation started or stopped running

key.description: Request key to create a unique subscription topic

publish.description: Publish on this topic to move the head of the robot

yaw.description: Desired yaw for this part if supported, -100 to 100

pitch.description: Desired pitch for this part if supported, -100 to 100

angle.description: The direction the part should move in

force.description: How strongly to perform the movement, 0 to 100

distance.description: How far the part should move, in meters

relative_rotation.description: The direction the part should move in relative to its current rotation where negative values rotate to the left and positive values rotate to the right, -360 to 360

publish.description: Publish on this topic to drive the robot

yaw.description: Desired yaw for this part if supported, -100 to 100

pitch.description: Desired pitch for this part if supported, -100 to 100

angle.description: The direction the part should move in

force.description: How strongly to perform the movement, 0 to 100

distance.description: How far the part should move, in meters

relative_rotation.description: The direction the part should move in relative to its current rotation where negative values rotate to the left and positive values rotate to the right, -360 to 360

publish.summary: Move a specific part of the robot
publish.description: Publish on this topic to move a specific part of the robot, like an arm or a leg

yaw.description: Desired yaw for this part if supported, -100 to 100

pitch.description: Desired pitch for this part if supported, -100 to 100

angle.description: The direction the part should move in

force.description: How strongly to perform the movement, 0 to 100

distance.description: How far the part should move, in meters

relative_rotation.description: The direction the part should move in relative to its current rotation where negative values rotate to the left and positive values rotate to the right, -360 to 360

name.description: Name of the part which you want to control

subscribe.description: A message (Boolean) is publish on this topic when the robot chassis starts, or stops moving.

publish.summary: Get list of available emotions for the eyes

subscribe.summary: response: Get list of available emotions for the eyes

key.description: Request key to create a unique subscription topic

publish.summary: Get all the gym movements that can be used in the composer

key.description: Request key to create a unique subscription topic
Required key

unit.description: Can be "s", "h" or "m" (seconds, hours, minutes), used for duration. Defaults to seconds

initialDelay.description: How long to wait until starting motion detection, in milliseconds. Defaults to 2000, lower values may cause false positives

interval.description: How often the camera should check for motion, in milliseconds. Defaults to 200

duration.description: The maximum time the motion detection will be active, after the time is elapsed, the motion detection will stop. Defaults to 10

stopOnDetection.description: If true the motion detection will stop after the first detection. Defaults to true

upload.description: If true, the picture with motion detected will be uploaded to the cloud. A notification is sent to zbos-control (if enabled). Defaults to false

stopAfterDuration.description: If true the motion detection will stop at the end of the duration. Defaults to true

image.description: Image of the detected motion, only given if upload is enabled in motion detection options.

Use this to make the robot say something.
Use this to make the robot say something with parameters. Only message is required, other params are optional.

key.description: Request key to create a unique subscription topic

publish.description: Event when the robot starts speaking and what it is saying

subscribe.summary: event: robot has recognised a hotword

publish.description: Start listening for hotword and commands
Start the dialog service so the robot can listen to the mic.
Stop the dialog service so the mic is free to use by other applications.

This is an extension for the grammar add topic. It removes all grammars first and then triggers a single platform reload. Hence grammars are added a lot faster.see <<zbos/dialog/grammars/add/response>> for response

id.description: a unique id of the grammar. This must be unique among the application (next field).

app.description: The application name. This will be used to determined which MQTT topic will be used to post the json output to.

input.description: Contains an array for each language with all the possible sentences. The sentences need to be in a format that the speech software understands.

publish.description: This is an extension for the grammar remove topic. It removes all grammars first and then triggers a single platform reload. Hence grammars are removed a lot faster.see <<zbos/dialog/grammars/remove/response>> for response

id.description: a unique id of the grammar. This must be unique among the application (next field).

app.description: The application name. This will be used to determined which MQTT topic will be used to post the json output to.

input.description: Contains an array for each language with all the possible sentences. The sentences need to be in a format that the speech software understands.

publish.description: Event when a custom grammar match is found, the output data is posted here.

triggered-by.description: The id of the grammer that has matched with the user input. This is the id from the input json.

language.description: Language that speech software was configured in when the sentence is recognised.

appId.description: Should be replaced by the app id used in the 'zbos/dialog/grammars/add/multiple' topic

subscribe.summary: response: Get all custom grammar rules

id.description: a unique id of the grammar. This must be unique among the application (next field).

app.description: The application name. This will be used to determined which MQTT topic will be used to post the json output to.

input.description: Contains an array for each language with all the possible sentences. The sentences need to be in a format that the speech software understands.

publish.description: Get a list of languages that the TTS engine can use to talk.see <<zbos/dialog/tts/languages/response/{key}>> for response

key.description: Request key to create a unique subscription topic

publish.description: Get a list of languages recognized by the ASR engine. note: For now this is limited to the language code defined in the config. No Vocon load check is done yet.see <<zbos/dialog/asr/languages/response/{key}>> for response

question.title: When was the first world war?

option_type.description: Only relevant for multiple choice questions

multi_select.description: Only relevant for multiple choice questions

options.description: Only relevant for multiple choice questions

correct_number.description: The slider value counted as a correct answer

index.description: The index of the corresponding option, only relevant for multiple choice questions

text.description: Only relevant for text input questions

subscribe.description: A message (json) is published on this topic when the robot battery status changes. Level is the battery level in percent. If the battery status is not yet available, then the level is -1.

key.description: Request key to create a unique subscription topic

id.description: Entry ID

data.description: Data required for the chosen task type
Data required for the chosen trigger type

weight.description: Weight of the entry, to give more granular control besides priority

concurrent.description: Determines if this entry can run concurrently with other entries

on_resume.description: Determines what should happen if the entry is resumed

launch_mode.description:
Determines what should happen if a trigger is hit when a task is already running.
- single_first: Allow single simultaneous execution. When a new execution is trying to start, it will not succeed and the previously running execution will continue.
- single_last: Allow single simultaneous execution. When a new execution is trying to start, the previously running executions will stop.
- multiple: Allow multiple simultaneous executions.

enabled.description: Enabled state of the entry trigger

executions.description: All current executions of the task

id.description: Execution ID

state.description: Current state of the entry task execution

info.description: Extra info/metadata about the task execution

- single_last: Allow single simultaneous execution. When a new execution is trying to start, the previously running executions will stop.
- multiple: Allow multiple simultaneous executions.

publish.description: Request all translation providers to register their translations using the topics below.

Add translations with their default values.
These default values will be used as long as they are not updated via zbos/translations/update

file.description:
Optional. Use either translations or file.
The file location should be a path accessible for the RAIL.
The content should be a json object with key-value pairs.
Dots (.) are not allowed in the keys and will be replaced with underscores (_)"

translations.description:
Optional. Use either translations or file
Dots (.) are not allowed in the keys and will be replaced with underscores (_)
